title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Monday 10 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: investigation after two from saltash and plymouth man die in a38 collision .
child almost falls through moving train 's toilet floor .
mp anne marie morris apologises for racist remark .
rick stein porthleven restaurant fire 'not deliberate ' , police say .
people in great torrington claim they 're struggling for cash after last bank closes .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: six-year-old boy first to ring 'end of cancer treatment ' bell
text: six-year-old cancer patient riley thomas is the first to ring an `` end of treatment '' bell installed in royal cornwall hospital .

documents.title: latest weather : sunshine in the evening before rain
text: evening sunshine is likely for many .
however , occasional rain will cross land 's end by midnight and spread across the region during the early hours .
minimum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
there will be patchy rain on tuesday morning .
it will intensify during the afternoon , becoming heavy for a time .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: in my place : disabled fan 's on-stage performance with coldplay
text: wheelchair user rob was crowdsurfing at global megastars coldplay 's concert at croke park in dublin on saturday .
he was then invited by exeter boy and frontman chris martin invited him on stage to perform .
rob described the experience .
author: BBC Three

documents.title: anne marie morris racist expression : members of political parties condemn mp
text: members of political parties across the spectrum have condemned a devon mp who used a racist expression during a public discussion about brexit .
anne marie morris , mp for newton abbot , used the phrase at an event in london to describe the prospect of the uk leaving the eu without a deal .
ms morris , who was first elected to parliament in 2010 , told the bbc the comment was `` totally '' unintentional , adding : `` i apologise unreservedly for any offence caused . ''
appalling .
should have the whip removed immediately .
no place in our politics for racism , full stop .
she 's from devon ( honest people ) people like u & neo liberal agenda have screwed the world .
there was no racism intended !
racism was inferred from the racist thing she said .
seems like an ( honest ) case of recognising something from what it actually looks like .
it was an innocent expression sub consciously spoken be honest how many times have you done that ?
i do n't think it was innocent .
i am not saying she 's wicked ( i do n't know ) , and i am not saying she should be imprisoned .
u said what 's not but not what is , like so many in today 's uk given pc & censorship you 're always careful not to upset .
what a way to live ?
not offending people is actually quite a pleasant way to live !
there was n't room to elaborate above ; to be clear , what it is , is offensive .
1 muslim mp wrote its appalling others said offensive appalling/offensive is muslims murdering beautiful innocent children at a concert .
more than one thing can be offensive at once .
oh come on.its bloody difficult for people of a certain age not to use the expressions we grew up with we all try we slip up + we 're sorry
utter rubbish .
i have n't used that expression or the n word since i was a kid in the 1950 's !
same here possible use in the 60s but that 's it .
are n't you being ridiculously oversensitive at what is simply clumsy ?
it 's you that 's giving undue emphasis to the misuse of words
no
the appalling delight of politically correct muppets that a tory mp made a clumsy mistake with the 'n ' word .
no one with any awareness makes 'careless ' mistakes with such emotive language .
let 's all dance round on tiptoes your pathetic oversensitivities shall we ?
try explaining that point of view to a black person and then complain they 're being over sensitive .
i live with black people .
they have far too much common sense to overreact to such a trivial , clumsy , mistake by another out-of-touch mp .
but you 're not black and so ca n't speak for them .
not to mention that it 's very presumptuous of you to think you can !
not surprised considering it is from the party that once had as as slogan `` if you want a n for a neighbour , vote labour '' # nastyparty
how about david lammy for his racist remark that a white man can not do the tower investigation ?
quiet on that i see .
how does that make what this woman said ok ?
but please show me where david lammy started calling us honkies .
if you are not informed enough to know what he said then do n't show your ignorance .
look it up .
even more so , please explain to me how that makes what this woman said , ok ?
it doesnt , just shows hypocrisy of the left .
shes suspended and whip removed now get over yourself .
so can you show me where lammy made racial slurs and used racist phrases ?
i 'm afraid an apology is not good enough - we must show zero tolerance for racism .
mps must lead by example .
you will be calling for the sacking of diane abbott and david lammy then too ?
why ?
which derogatory , racist terms do you think they have been using ?
abbott thought blonde , blue eyed finnish nurses could n't look after black people .
lammy thinks white people shouldnt head grenfell enquiry .
still waiting to hear an accusation of offensive , racist language .
that is offensive and racist .
have not seen the comments you refer to in original context .
do you have a reference or source ?
lammy- white judge not suitable for grenfell enquiry .
imagine the reverse was said .
people of all races and colours died in the tower .
not a derogatory , racist remark and not comparable .
does that include the anti semitic behaviour exhibited by some in the labour party ?
or is that acceptable ?
glad you asked that , 'unreservedly ' is a good apology & an immediate one .
perhaps she 'd liked to see her stoned to death that would cheer up the left .
you do know @ twitterid is a # tory ?
are you saying that if someone is a tory that they should n't be allowed to express an opinion ?
i 'm a tory ! !
am i not allowed a voice ?
me too !
right or wrong we can comment .
if corbyn is ever elected they will have special camps for tories .
what do you suggest ?
stoning on the floor of the house ?
stop virtue signalling .
she made a mistake , she apologised .
so you think it is ok to be a racist then , and only apologise when your necks on the line .
is there any evidence that she is racist or was it just a mistake to use an old expression even though the word used is unacceptable .
i 'm 5 years older than morris and the n word was in common use in my youth .
using it 50 years later is absolutely inexcusable
i 'm even older than that & i remember those days too.it is unacceptable i agree & must be apologized for , which as i understand it , has been
it 's the casual acceptance of racism that defines everything that is wrong in the uk at the moment .
an apology is n't enough
there is no casual acceptance of racism here .
you know not of which you speak .
faux outrage of someone who chooses to live elsewhere than uk
as a uk tax payer and voter my opinion is valid .
maybe your casual racism is getting to your head .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: vandals 'force closure of dartmoor car park '
text: a dartmoor public car park has closed because of vandalism and littering .
the spitchwick public car park , near ashburton , was recently closed by landowner patrick simpson .
people were reported to have been smashing bottles on the rock face and abusing civil enforcement officers .
mr simpson said he reluctantly had to place boulders across the site to mark the closure .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: devon resort named as one of the uk 's child smoking blackspots
text: torbay has the third highest child smoking rate in the uk , according to new figures published today .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: boy narrowly avoids falling through train floor
text: the rail accident investigation branch is looking into an incident where a mother and her son narrowly avoided falling through a missing floor on a moving train on the south devon railway .
author: Johnny Rutherford
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: calls for mp to have tory whip withdrawn after racist expression
text: the liberal democrats have called on prime minister theresa may to withdraw the party whip from a devon conservative mp criticised after it emerged she used a racist expression during a public discussion about brexit .
anne marie morris , mp for newton abbot , used the phrase at an event in london to describe the prospect of the uk leaving the eu without a deal .
leader tim farron said he was `` shocked '' and called for her to be suspended from the parliamentary party .
`` this disgusting comment has no place in our parliament , '' he said .
ms morris , who was first elected to parliament in 2010 , told the bbc the comment was `` totally '' unintentional , adding : `` i apologise unreservedly for any offence caused . ''
a conservative party spokesman said : `` we are aware of these reports .
this kind of language is completely unacceptable and we are urgently investigating . ''
political editor laura kuenssberg tweeted that the pressure was `` already for may to withdraw the whip from morris '' , which would mean `` another one off the majority if she does '' .
pressure on already for may to withdraw the whip from morris - another one off the majority if she does
you have n't researched this have you ?
that constituency is overwhelmingly tory & brexit backing .
are you silently applauding laura ?
time for another election .
withdraw the whip ?
wow so harsh or alternatively she should be sacked & put in prison .
apologists for racism smeh
why has laura kuenssberg always a negative view when reporting on the conservative party when she says one off majority
so this is n't the first time the ugly head of racism in the tory party rears its head .
the tories have a problem with racism .
wishful thinking
so she suddenly turns into an anti-government voter ?
# underjeremysspell
pressure on the bbc to withdraw you too .
my mp p bottomley refuses to answer my question on his opinion on the dup deal , in spite of his record supporting the things dup against .
she has to
why should she anti semetic labour dont
fake majority irrelevant .
wrong is wrong .
principles before power
you know they 're tories , right ?
just one of the names i call them
her human rights should be withdrawn .
are you reporting , or gloating ?
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: bank santander to close helston branch
text: santander 's bank branch in helston is to close .
it follows the closure of the hsbc bank in the town in recent months , and the loss of two building society offices locally .
santander said the decision was not been taken lightly .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: mp anne marie morris apologises for racist remark
text: a devon conservative mp has been criticised after it emerged she used a racist expression during a public discussion about brexit .
anne marie morris , mp for newton abbot , used the phrase at an event in london to describe the prospect of the uk leaving the eu without a deal .

according to a recording published on the huffington post website , ms morris was discussing the impact of brexit on the uk 's financial services industry at an event organised by the politeia think tank .
the lib dems have urged theresa may to discipline her for the `` nasty '' remark .
ms morris told the bbc : `` the comment was totally unintentional .
i apologise unreservedly for any offence caused . ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: everyone is laughing at new terror group cornish republican army
text: cheeky internet trolls have flooded social media and message boards to mock a cornish nationalist group .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: child avoids falling through train floor : what happened ?
text: a small boy almost fell from a moving train carriage on to the track below because the toilet floor was missing .
his mother was able to catch him before he fell when she took him to the toilet on the south devon railway totnes riverside to buckfastleigh train in devon last month .

the rail accident investigation branch said its investigation found that the former ex-british railways mark 1 open second carriage `` had been put back into service after repairs to its braking system , which had required the dismantling of the lavatory floor '' .
it said : `` the floor had not been replaced and staff had placed a notice on the compartment door and attempted to secure it to prevent it being opened .
this had not been effective . ''
south devon railway , which runs the steam train attraction , said it is taking the investigation `` extremely seriously '' .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: exmouth man arrested after one killed and seven injured in m42 crash
text: one person was killed when four cars and a lorry crashed on the m42 near redditch and bromsgrove .
three of the cars went up in flames after the smash on the southbound junction of the motorway last night .
one woman was pulled from a flaming car by an off-duty paramedic who ran to her aid .
a 52-year-old man from exmouth , devon , has been arrested on sus of death by dangerous driving , police say .
he remains in police custody .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: newquay paddle-out to remember surf and wetsuit pioneer jack o'neill
text: a mass 'paddle out ' in # cornwall to remember the man who invented the wetsuit .
jack o'neill died last month at the age of 94
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: enhanced security for little mix and bryan adams in exeter
text: with just days to go until bryan adams and little mix arrive in exeter for their hotly anticipated shows at powderham castle , event organisers have issued important information ahead of the concerts .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: row over porthleven double yellow lines
text: a row has broken out over 200ft of new double yellow lines in porthleven .
they 've been painted along commercial road , which is owned by harbour and dock company .
phil ward , from the company , said it was part of a project to calm the traffic .
however , cornwall council said the lines were not legal , had no legal standing , and no enforcement could be carried out by anyone .
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon travel update : delays in braunton and exmouth
text: devon travel update : delays in braunton and exmouth
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: police appeal for missing torquay man
text: devon and cornwall police are asking for help to find a man who 's gone missing from torquay .
police said the 53-year-old was reported missing from home on sunday morning and that officers , a police helicopter and coastguards had been conducting coastal and inland searches .
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: native seahorse makes a rare return
text: divers in the south west have had a rare sighting of one of our native seahorses .
the creature is under threat , along with its natural habitat - seagrass - which provides a nursery for all kinds of marine life and helps reduce coastal erosion .
experts at the national marine aquarium in plymouth said they were now looking at how best to help our seahorses by learning how to cultivate seagrass , because it was in worldwide decline .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: rick stein restaurant fire 'not deliberate ' , police say
text: devon and cornwall police say claims that a fire at rick stein 's restaurant in porthleven was started deliberately are not credible .
the blaze , in a bin store on 12 june , is thought to have been caused by an electrical fault .
police said they would respond robustly to any threats of terrorism after comments on social media , and asked anyone with information to contact them .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: dead livestock 'washing up in fields '
text: landowners on the banks of the river tamar say there 's a growing problem with dead livestock in the water or being washed up on surrounding fields .
the cattle have no eartags and the environment agency said it would only remove them if they posed a flood risk by blocking bridges or culverts .
andy reeve , who runs a riding stable on land near the tamar , said he could n't get the agency , the rspca or cornwall council to take action .
`` if the animal 's in the river , it 's very hard from a farm boundary to decide who actually owns that bit , '' he said .
`` i would suggest the state vets would be responsible for removing and finding out where it came from . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: woman and son killed in a38 crash
text: police have confirmed that a 32-year-old woman from saltash and her six-year-old son died as a result of the a38 crash near landrake on sunday .
five vehicles were involved in the crash which was caused by a car stopping at the side of the road .
a 53-year-old plymouth man also died , officers said .
another son of the woman , who is aged four , was in hospital , they added .
a total of nine people were injured in the collision .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: crime in your town : 108 crimes reported in redruth area in one month
text: a total of 108 crimes were logged in redruth and some of its surrounded villages in just one month , according to street-by-street figures released by devon and cornwall police .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: apology after young boy almost falls through moving train floor
text: south devon railway has apologised to a mother whose young son almost fell through the floor of a carriage on a moving train .
authorities are investigating after the incident last month on a train from totnes to buckfastleigh on the heritage attraction 's seven-mile line .
the boy tried to go into a toilet compartment which did not have a floor , leaving the carriage wheels below exposed .

an sdr spokesman said : `` the south devon railway takes this incident extremely seriously in which safety on a moving train was badly compromised and that could have resulted in serious injury to a female passenger and her young son .
`` we regret that this incident took place and wish to apologise to the lady and family involved for the trauma which they suffered .

`` on the day in question , something clearly went wrong with our safety control and hazard monitoring systems as evidenced by the incident having taken place - it simply should not have happened . ''
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: stopped car led to cornwall triple fatal crash
text: a crash in which three people including a child died followed a vehicle stopping on the side of the road , it has emerged .
a man got out of the stopped car on the plymouth-bound carriageway of the a38 before a car travelling the other way hit him , said police .
a woman and a child in another car also died in a series of vehicle crashes .
the victims ' families were `` devastated '' said ch insp adrian leisk of devon and cornwall police .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: wreck survivor meets rescue crew after 53 years
text: the last survivor of a shipwreck has been reunited with two of the lifeboat men who rescued him .
benito mayo nunez , 71 , was one of just four to survive when the coaster juan ferrer was washed on to rocks off cornwall in 1963 .
the penlee lifeboat was launched , but just four of the 15 crew could be saved .
mr nunez returned to attend a memorial service and lay a wreath .
he met nim bawden and melvin mcclary , both 83 , who were on board the solomon browne lifeboat that night .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: yeandle urges exeter to be 'aggressors '
text: exeter chiefs captain jack yeandle says the premiership champions must stay on the front foot if they are to build on their success this upcoming season .
the 27-year-old hooker played 26 times last term as the devon side beat wasps to become english champions in may .
`` it 's very much about going out and firing the shot , and not looking for teams to fire shots at us , '' yeandle told bbc sport .
`` you do n't want teams coming at you , you want to be the ones going at teams and antagonising the opposition . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: plan to rescue tiny primary school
text: parents say they believe they 've come up with a viable plan to save one of the smallest schools in cornwall .
directors of the multi-academy trust which runs st martin-in-meneage , on the lizard , have been meeting to decide whether or not to close the primary school which has only 12 pupils .

david murray , co-chair of the st martin action group , said parents did not like the younger children being taught part of the week in st martin and part of the week in nearby coverack , as happens at the moment .
he said their plan included integrating a revived preschool into the main primary , and running two classes in the morning and one in the afternoon .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: american gun lobby comes out in favour of crime czar alison hernandez
text: america 's powerful gun lobby group the national rifle association ( nra ) has come out with all guns blazing in support of devon and cornwall police commissioner alison hernandez .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: alcohol and gas seized by police in newquay
text: the latest seizure is a continuation of work which last week saw seven bottles of vodka taken from teenagers visiting newquay .
those bottles were taken from one room with six 16 to 18-year-olds in it , police said .
the canisters above are suspected nitrous oxide .
the sale of the gas for human consumption , used as a party drug , has been illegal since may when the psychoactive substances act came into force .
the town is expected to see thousands of teenage visitors over the next few months , with many being allowed to travel to cornwall alone with friends to celebrate the end of exams .
police have appealed to parents to `` be responsible '' and not give alcohol to teenagers heading for the resort .
we continue our efforts to safeguard young persons .
this was seized from one groups accommodation today .
silver canisters are nitrous .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: man charged after seven-vehicle crash in plymouth
text: the man was arrested after the crash involving seven vehicles on a residential street in plymouth .
one car hit a wall and then six parked vehicles , causing extensive damage , in the early hours of sunday , police said .
three people were taken to derriford hospital in the city but were not believed to have serious injuries .
update : driver charged with s5 rta ( drink drive ) & due care # noexcuse
what a surprise when will these people learn ?

documents.title: narrow escape for child who almost fell through train toilet floor
text: authorities are investigating after a child almost fell through a train toilet floor on a devon railway last month .

a passenger and her child attempted to enter a toilet compartment in a carriage on a train from totnes to buckfastleigh on the south devon railway , when they found the floor of the compartment was missing , exposing the carriage wheels below , the rail accident investigation branch ( raib ) said .
the mother was able to catch hold of the child and prevent him from falling .
the child reportedly suffered minor bruising and both were left shocked , the raib said .
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel update : fire on the a30
text: on the a30 , just after the chiverton roundabout heading eastbound , towards carland cross , there are reports of a vehicle fire .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : slow-moving traffic on the a38
text: travel update : slow-moving traffic on the a38
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lifeboat rescues bodyboarder from gannel rocks
text: a 25-year-old man has been rescued by lifeboat volunteers after being swept along the gannel estuary at east pentire in cornwall .
the man was found clinging to the rocks about 19:30 last night after being swept along the estuary by a strong ebb tide .

he was rescued by rnli crew on a lifeboat from newquay within 10 minutes of launching and was reunited with his family , including his father , who had earlier entered the water in an attempt to assist his son but had been unable to reach him .
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: investigations continue into a38 crash
text: a police investigation is under way into a fatal multiple car collision in cornwall in which three people died , including a child .
a further nine people were injured in the crash on the a38 in south east cornwall .
police , fire and ambulance crews were called at 11.15 yesterday to the collision involving five cars between tideford and landrake .
chief inspector adrian leisk , of devon and cornwall police , said a vehicle stopped on the plymouth-bound road .
he said : `` someone has got out of that vehicle , and then been struck by a vehicle travelling in the opposite direction .
subsequently then , a number of other vehicles have become involved , and , sadly , two other occupants of another vehicle have died . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: are homeless people sleeping rough in devon barns and outhouses ?
text: people are sleeping rough in barns and outhouses as a hidden homelessness crisis hits rural areas , an influential think tank has warned .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: water to be restored in wadebridge by 10:30
text: we have got most supplies back on in # pl27 # wadebridge but are working to restore the remaining properties by 10:30 .

documents.title: 'most heartbreaking shift i 've done , ' says police officer after a38 fatal crash
text: a police investigation is under way into a fatal multiple car collision in cornwall in which three people died , including a child , on the a38 in south east cornwall .
hardest , most heartbreaking shift i 've done in my 6 yrs of # policing i will be holding my loved ones even closer tonight .
# police
take care kirsty , these are really tough , especially when children are involved .
hopefully the support is in place for you .
thank you sir , a horrible day .
your teams were a massive help , support & comfort , ca n't thank them enough .
# police
that 's really good to hear , but we will ensure ongoing support and monitoring are in place .
thank you # police
massive respect for you and all your colleagues for what you see and deal with .
much love to you .
thank you # police
lots of people in st germans touched by the events yesterday .
tragic .
thank you for everything you and colleagues across the services do
thank you for your support # police
hold on tight take care & big hugs .
great team work today x
thank you very much # police
horrendous shift kirsty , talk to ur mates take help that 's offered at work .
you 'll come out the other side ok x
thank you , i will do # police
bless you , thank you # police
sadly i 've attended many and it 's very hard but rest assured your colleagues locally and across the country are here for you .
joe
thank you # police
were all here for you @ twitterid !
twitter family !
thank you jack # police
hard day at the office today , hope you are ok thoughts with you .
my heart felt thoughts are with the families tonight
thank you for all you 've done .
just heartbroken , thoughts are with everyone .
thank you again # police

documents.title: cornwall beavers 'playing and scoffing '
text: the beavers have been released into an enclosure on farmland near truro in an effort to help prevent flooding in the village of ladock .
their first efforts to build a dam have already been photographed .

documents.title: weather update : a drizzly day ahead
text: today will start off cloudy with patchy light rain or drizzle , but it 'll become brighter with some spells of sunshine developing .
however , cloud will increase again this afternoon with a few scattered showers moving in from the west .
light to moderate northwesterly winds will also turn to the west this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: missing hiker 's rucksack found at top of cliff
text: fears are growing for a 17-year-old hiker whose backpack was found at the top of cliffs in cornwall .
the family of finnian layland-stratfield is appealing for anyone who has seen him to get in touch with police .
he was last seen between 17:00 and 17:30 on sunday on the cliffs above hole beach , tintagel .
his rucksack containing some personal belongings was found on cliffs above the beach .
police said he was believed to be wearing a blue superdry hoodie , grey/black jeans with holes in the knees , and black army-style boots .
he was carrying the rucksack which is khaki green .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: mum who thought her son needed glasses told he has months to live
text: a boy who was having problems with his sight has been heartbreakingly told he has a brain tumour and just months to live .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: the town with no cash ?
text: people in a devon town claim they 're struggling to get hold of their own money after its last bank and 24-hour cash machine closed .
lloyds bank shut its branch and machine in great torrington two weeks ago .
locals report that , since then , other cash machines at local businesses have been running out of money and shops have been limiting cashback .
lloyds banking group said a public consultation was held into the branch closure and that its mobile banking service was visiting the town twice a week .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: power problems in wadebridge
text: we are sorry about the # powercut in the # wadebridge # pl27 areas .
engineers are working on this and aim to have all supplies back on by 09:30

documents.title: a serene start in paignton
text: paignton looking serene at dawn this morning , but it 's mostly cloudy across devon and cornwall with just a little drizzle in places .
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: travel update : roadworks causing delays
text: there 's a few delays around this morning :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: investigations continue after fatal a38 crash
text: investigations will continue this morning into a five-vehicle crash in cornwall which left three people dead .
the crash happened yesterday morning on the a38 near landrake .
a woman and a child from one car lost their lives .
a male pedestrian also died .
nine other people were injured , including a child who was airlifted to hospital in bristol .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: local live in devon and cornwall
text: happy monday !
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch , please email us
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online
